item.title: How to get Twitter API tokens
item.description: It maybe seems that start playing with Twitter API can be hard to start, but actually it’s not. First of all, you need to get tokens, to start. And this process is very easy.

item.title: 41 week report
item.description: Almost nothing: almost finished generator-travis, waiting two pull-requests to be merged, good article about functional programming, laptop is still under repair.

item.title: 40 week report
item.description: get-tweets 2.0, generator-travis 1.0, some java coding, minor geo tags on index page on jsunderhood.ru, water on mars, tesla x, menubar with text, roadmap for jsunderhood, kinda roadmap for generator-travis

item.title: How to start with nodejs testing
item.description: With this 5 minute intro I’ll show how to test your code with yayify example, which only add 'yay' to the end of the string. If you heard about testing and tdd, but still haven’t tried then this article is definitely for you.

item.title: iojs is joining the Node Foundation. What does it mean?
item.description: I really love iojs project and it’s impact on nodejs ecosystem. I love semver, frequent releases and open governance model. Also I didn’t love waiting for node@0.12 for ages. I pretty sure if iojs will not happen, then node@0.12 will not happen either.

item.title: Just published get-tweets package
item.description: Get all tweets for target username.

item.title: Weekly 20
item.description: In short: iojs is joining (new) Node, Elon Musk gives interview, video-selfies with flying lily, and all you need is PostCSS.

item.title: Gmail setup
item.description: I discovered that gmail is not very friendly by default. Gmail mark message as "read" only after 3 seconds, you cannot use it from keyboard and it have no preview for emails. But slow and abandoned gmail chat is turned on. Good try, gmail!

item.title: Deploy to GitHub pages from Travis CI
item.description: Imagine that you have open-source project, which site is hosting on github pages and you have "edit on github" button on this site. It’s great, because if you are lucky, you will get few pull-requests every week. On the other side you will need laptop every time, you want to deploy changes and, you know, it’s a bit annoying.

item.title: commonmark-helpers is out!
Every technical article must have publish date
Speed up your development with npm init command
item.description: npm has a great command npm init which allows you to create package.json in a second!

item.title: Minimum viable blog
item.description: You should have ability to write it, readers — to read it. Content is a king. Spend time on writing, not on developing.
